revised_title: Strong Shock Waves Generated by Rapid Heat Addition in Confined Gases
tldr: The authors studied the formation and evolution of strong shock waves in a confined gas due to rapid heat addition at the boundary. They used the complete Navier-Stokes equations to describe the thermomechanical response of the gas near the boundary and found that the power density in the conduction layer determines shock strength. The results provide a rational basis for the piston analogies used by earlier authors and show the importance of power as a crucial factor in shock wave strength.
